original: sgrib pa dang bral ba nyid thob par 'gyur zhing tshig gzung bar 'os par 'gyur /
analyzed: sgrib pa dang bral ba nyid thob par 'gyur zhing tshig gzung bar 'os par 'gyur /

original: lha thams cad kyis bzung zhing kun nas srung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: lha thams cad kyis bzung zhing kun nas srung bar 'gyur /

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung thob par 'gyur /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung thob par 'gyur /

analyzed: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gzigs bzhed par 'gyur /

original: tshe ring ba dang / sgrib pa dang / nad dang bral bar 'gyur /
analyzed: tshe ring ba dang / sgrib pa dang / nad dang bral bar 'gyur /

original: tshe 'phos nas 'jig rten gyi khams bde ba can du skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: tshe 'phos nas 'jig rten gyi khams bde ba can du skye bar 'gyur /

original: tshe rabs su tshe rabs dran par 'gyur /
analyzed: tshe rabs su tshe rabs dran par 'gyur /

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba bsod nams kyi tshogs thams cad dang ldan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba bsod nams kyi tshogs thams cad dang ldan par 'gyur te /
translated: He will be endowed with all the roots of virtue and the accumulations of merit.

analyzed: snying rje dang / byams pa chen po yid la bya ba rtse gcig tu bya zhing smyung ba dang / bzlas brjod bya'o //
translated: He should one-pointedly keep in mind the practice of great compassion and love, and should fast and recite.

original: sdig pa dang / sgrib pa zad par bya ba'i dkyil 'khor chen po'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: sdig pa dang / sgrib pa zad par bya ba'i dkyil 'khor chen po'i cho ga'o //
translated: This is the procedure for the great maṇḍala for the exhaustion of misdeeds and obscurations.

analyzed: 'phags pa don yod pa'i zhags pa'i cho ga zhib mo'i rgyal po; bam po bcu bdun pa /

analyzed: de nas rtag tu bzlas pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga bshad par bya ste /

analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi tshad ji lta ba bzhin du legs par phye ba /

original: gru bzhi @114a *//
analyzed: gru bzhi @114a *//

analyzed: pa; rgyar gzings kyi tshad kyis shin tu rnam par phye ba bya ste /
translated: and well-divided by the measure of a chariot.

analyzed: dri'i tshon rtsi rnam par bkra ba kun nas padma'i phreng ba dang / rdo rje'i ge sar la brten pa'i dbus su padma bya'o //
translated: In the middle, a lotus should be drawn, variegated with fragrant colors, surrounded by a garland of lotuses and a ring of vajras.

original: rdo rje'i thig skud kyis kun nas bskor ba'i dbus kyi padma'i ge sar la 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug tshangs pa'i cha byad 'dzin pa dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje'i thig skud kyis kun nas bskor ba'i dbus kyi padma'i ge sar la 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug tshangs pa'i cha byad 'dzin pa dgod par bya'o //
translated: In the middle of the lotus, in the center surrounded by vajra threads, one should place the noble Avalokiteśvara, wearing the form of Brahmā.

original: nyi ma re re zhing me tog dang bdug pa dbul bar bya zhing /
analyzed: nyi ma re re zhing me tog dang bdug pa dbul bar bya zhing /

original: nyi ma re re zhing aa ga ru'i bdug pa dang / khrus byas gos gtsang ma bgos te don yod rgyal po'i bzlas brjod dang / phyag rgya bcing bar bya'o //
analyzed: nyi ma re re zhing aa ga ru'i bdug pa dang / khrus byas gos gtsang ma bgos te don yod rgyal po'i bzlas brjod dang / phyag rgya bcing bar bya'o //
translated: Every day, having bathed with agaru incense and put on clean clothes, one should recite the mantra of Amoghapāśa and form the mudrā.

analyzed: yi ge gcig po'i snying po'i bzlas brjod thun gsum du lan gsum mam /
translated: One should recite the essence mantra of the single syllable three times,

original: lan bdun nam /
analyzed: lan bdun nam /
translated: seven times,

original: lan nyi shu rtsa gcig tu bzla'o //
analyzed: lan nyi shu rtsa gcig tu bzla'o //
translated: or twenty-one times, in three sessions.

original: zas ngan pa bcu yongs su spang bar bya zhing /
analyzed: zas ngan pa bcu yongs su spang bar bya zhing /
translated: One should avoid the ten bad foods

original: sems can ngan pa yang spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: sems can ngan pa yang spang bar bya'o //

analyzed: sgrub thabs kyi de kho na nyid las thams cad du 'jig rten pa'i bya ba thams cad 'grub bo //

analyzed: 'jigs pa chen po mi bzad pa brgyad po de rnams las grol lo //
translated: One is freed from those eight great, unbearable fears.

analyzed: don yod pa'i rgyal po dran pas nad thams cad rnam par nyams par byed do //
translated: By remembering Amoghavajra, all illnesses are destroyed.

analyzed: snying na ba dang / lto na ba dang / so dang / mchun ba dang / lag pa na ba dang / rtsib logs na ba dang / chu so na ba dang / pho ba'i nad dang / ma zhu ba dang / rkang pa na ba dang /

analyzed: bsod nams chen po dang ldan par 'gyur ro //

original: tshig btsun par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshig btsun par yang 'gyur ro //

analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad kyi bla mar yang 'gyur ro //

original: don che zhing che ba dag 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don che zhing che ba dag 'ong bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: rgyal po dang / btsun mo'i 'khor dang / g-yog tu bcas pas gcig tu mchod par 'os par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: nyi ma re re zhing 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug mthong bar 'gyur @115a *//

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang dag par brgyan pa mthong ngo //

translated: On the eighth and fifteenth days of the month, in the palace on Potala Mountain, the abode of the holy Avalokiteśvara, he sees the holy Avalokiteśvara expounding the Dharma to a great assembly, and he sees Amitābha dwelling in the Land of Bliss.

analyzed: ji srid byang chub snying po'i bar du mthong ngo //

analyzed: 'chi 'phos pa na bsams pa nyid kyi mod la bde ba can gyi 'jig rten gyi khams su skye bar 'gyur te /

analyzed: rgyan thams cad kyis rnam par brgyan par padma las brdzus te skye bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gang zhig thob pas sangs rgyas kyi zhing gang+g'a'i klung gi bye ma bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag snyed las 'das pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la mngon par phyag byas nas se gol gtogs pa tsam nyid la slar yang 'ong ba de
translated: Having attained that samādhi, he prostrates to all the tathāgatas who are beyond as many buddhafields as there are grains of sand in the Ganges river, and in the time it takes to snap one’s fingers, he returns again.

analyzed: lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin so sor thob bo //

analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gzhan khrag khrig brgya stong phrag so sor thob cing /
translated: He attains individually other samādhis, many hundreds of thousands of quintillions.

analyzed: bzlas pa'i cho ga gcig pus las thams cad sgrub par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: zhes @115b so; ;bzlas pa'i dkyil 'khor chen po'i cho ga'o //
translated: This is the rite of the great maṇḍala of recitation.

analyzed: de nas khrus kyi dkyil 'khor bshad par bya ste /

analyzed: khrus byed pa la mkhas pa gang gis dri ma thams cad sel bar byed cing mdzes pa /

analyzed: sdig pa thams cad rnam par nyams par byed pa /

analyzed: dngos grub thams cad byed pa'i de kho na nyid bsod nams dang gzi brjid rab tu 'phel bar byed pa /
translated: It is the reality that accomplishes all powers, increases merit and splendor,

analyzed: nad thams cad sel bar grub pa; sdig pa dang / sdig to nyams par byed pa /
translated: cures all illnesses, and destroys evil and sin.

original: de bzhin du zad pa dang nyams pa bcom pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du zad pa dang nyams pa bcom pa /
translated: It destroys exhaustion and decline,

original: dug dang byad stems nyams pa /
analyzed: dug dang byad stems nyams pa /
translated: destroys poison and sorcery,

original: nad yun ring po yongs su spangs pa /
analyzed: nad yun ring po yongs su spangs pa /

analyzed: de bzhin du gcod yun ring po dang rims yongs su spangs pa ste /
translated: It also completely eliminates long-term cutting and contagious fevers.

original: 'di dag khrus kyis 'grub ste /
analyzed: 'di dag khrus kyis 'grub ste /
translated: These are accomplished through ablution.

analyzed: rig sngags gang yin pa des 'grub par don yod pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gis yongs su bsgrags so //
translated: Avalokiteśvara, the one with unfailing eyes, has proclaimed that they are accomplished by any awareness mantra.

translated: For those afflicted by obstacles, those afflicted by the terrible plague of the shadow demon, those with the terrible fear of enemy armies, those in disputes and conflicts, those defeated by enemies,

analyzed: skye bo sdang ba dang / gang gi 'khrug pa'i g-yul du song ba dang / rgyu skar gyis bcom pa gang yin pa dang / blo'i skye ba zad pa dang / ma ning dang / nyams pa'i ma ning dang / dbang po nyams pa'i bar gang yin pa rnams dang /
translated: those who are hated by people, those who have gone to war, those who have been struck by the stars, those who have exhausted their mental faculties, those who are neuter, those who are impotent, and those who have impaired faculties,

analyzed: bu mi 'tsho ba gang yin pa rnams kyi bu mthun par skye bar 'gyur @116a *// ro; ;bsad cing gzhom pa thob pa gang yin pa dang / 'ching ba dang / gsod par song ba gang yin pa dang / chom rkun nam /

original: rkun mo'i nang ngam /🔽gnod sbyin nam /
analyzed: rkun mo'i nang ngam / gnod sbyin nam /

analyzed: srin po'i nang du song ba gang yin pa dang / gcan gzan gtum po'i nang du song ba gang yin pa dang / mche ba gdug pa dang / dug gi khrod du song bas dug 'jigs pa mi bzad pa zos pa gang yin pa dang /
translated: or rākṣasas, those who are among fierce wild animals, those who are among poisonous snakes, those who have eaten terrible poisonous foods,

original: khyim rdib pa dang / g-yang sa dang / byi ba kha gdug pa'i 'jigs pa rnams dang / mi mngon par sdig pa byed pa gang yin pa dang / mtshams med pa byed pa gang yin pa dang / 'phags pa la skur pa 'debs pa dang /
analyzed: khyim rdib pa dang / g-yang sa dang / byi ba kha gdug pa'i 'jigs pa rnams dang / mi mngon par sdig pa byed pa gang yin pa dang / mtshams med pa byed pa gang yin pa dang / 'phags pa la skur pa 'debs pa dang /
translated: those who commit evil deeds in secret, those who commit heinous acts, those who slander the noble ones,

analyzed: dam pa'i chos spong ba 'di rnams dkyil 'khor du khrus byas pas thams cad yang dag par zad par 'gro zhing /
translated: and those who abandon the true Dharma—all of these will be completely purified by bathing in the maṇḍala.

original: myur du thams cad rnam par nyams par byed de /
analyzed: myur du thams cad rnam par nyams par byed de /
translated: They will quickly be completely destroyed,

analyzed: rtsva rnams mes sreg pa bzhin du sngon bsags pa'i mi bzad pa'i las 'di dag thams cad rnam par nyams par byed do //
translated: just as grass is burned by fire. All of these unbearable previously accumulated karmas will be completely destroyed.

original: 'jig rten thams cad kyi bla ma dang / rtag tu mchod par 'os par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad kyi bla ma dang / rtag tu mchod par 'os par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will become the guru of the entire world and always worthy of offerings.

original: tshe yun ring por gnas te /
analyzed: tshe yun ring por gnas te /
translated: They will live a long life.

original: rtag tu bde ba dang / dga' bar byed do //
analyzed: rtag tu bde ba dang / dga' bar byed do //

analyzed: ji srid 'tsho'i bar du nad med cing rims med pa nyid du gnas so //
translated: For as long as they live, they will remain free from illness and free from contagious diseases.

original: bde blag tu bya ba byed cing /
analyzed: bde blag tu bya ba byed cing /
translated: One will be able to perform activities with ease.

original: de'i skye ba bdun dran par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i skye ba bdun dran par 'gyur ro //

original: lha @116b rnams kyis rtag tu srung bar byed cing /
analyzed: lha @116b rnams kyis rtag tu srung bar byed cing /
translated: The gods will always protect one.

original: mthar thug rtag tu dpal 'bar bar byed do //
analyzed: mthar thug rtag tu dpal 'bar bar byed do //
translated: In the end, one will always blaze with glory.

original: sangs rgyas rnams rtag tu mthong ba dang / rtag tu 'jig rten dbang phyug gi mchog sbyin  par byed pa dang / rtag tu mthong par 'dod pa yang thun mtshams rtag tu mngon sum du mthong bas gnas par byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams rtag tu mthong ba dang / rtag tu 'jig rten dbang phyug gi mchog sbyin  par byed pa dang / rtag tu mthong par 'dod pa yang thun mtshams rtag tu mngon sum du mthong bas gnas par byed do //
translated: One will always see the buddhas, always see the supreme lord of the world, and always see those who wish to be seen, by being present at all times.

original: rtag tu rig sngags dang / dkyil 'khor gyi lha dang / rig sngags kyi dngos grub tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: rtag tu rig sngags dang / dkyil 'khor gyi lha dang / rig sngags kyi dngos grub tu 'gyur te /
translated: One will always have the knowledge-mantra, the deity of the maṇḍala, and the accomplishment of the knowledge-mantra.

original: rtag tu dkyil 'khor gyi mchog gang yin pa yang sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: rtag tu dkyil 'khor gyi mchog gang yin pa yang sgrub par byed do //
translated: One will always accomplish whatever is the supreme maṇḍala.

original: rgyar gzings kyi tshad kyi dkyil 'khor gru bzhi pa bya ste /
analyzed: rgyar gzings kyi tshad kyi dkyil 'khor gru bzhi pa bya ste /
translated: One should make a square maṇḍala the size of a wagon,

original: tshon sna tshogs pas rnam par phye ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi mchog bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshon sna tshogs pas rnam par phye ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi mchog bri bar bya'o //
translated: and draw the supreme maṇḍala divided with various colors.

original: me tog dang 'bras bu sna tshogs pas bkra ba /
analyzed: me tog dang 'bras bu sna tshogs pas bkra ba /
translated: It is variegated with various flowers and fruits.

original: sgo bzhi kun nas rnam par phye ba dang / las rnams legs par zin nas dbus kyi dkyil 'khor gyi snying por 'khor lo yang dag par bri'o //
analyzed: sgo bzhi kun nas rnam par phye ba dang / las rnams legs par zin nas dbus kyi dkyil 'khor gyi snying por 'khor lo yang dag par bri'o //
translated: It has four doors that are completely opened, and once the activities are completed, the wheel is drawn in the center of the mandala.

original: padma'i lte ba dang / snying po nyid kyang 'bar bar bya'o //
analyzed: padma'i lte ba dang / snying po nyid kyang 'bar bar bya'o //
translated: The center of the lotus and the pericarp should also be ablaze.

original: zur dang zur rnams su zhags pa 'bar ba padma la gnas pa bya'o //
analyzed: zur dang zur rnams su zhags pa 'bar ba padma la gnas pa bya'o //
translated: In the corners and the intermediate directions, blazing nooses should be drawn, located on the lotus.

original: rig sngags 'dod pas khrus dang gtor ma dkar po yang 'dir dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: rig sngags 'dod pas khrus dang gtor ma dkar po yang 'dir dgod par bya'o //
translated: One who desires the knowledge-mantra should also place here ablutions and white oblations.

original: aa ga ru'i bdug pa dbul zhing /
analyzed: aa ga ru'i bdug pa dbul zhing /
translated: One should offer incense of aloeswood.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga ji lta ba bzhin du dkyil 'khor legs par brgyan par bya'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga ji lta ba bzhin du dkyil 'khor legs par brgyan par bya'o //
translated: One should adorn the mandala as prescribed in the mandala ritual.

original: las gzhan sgrub pa ni /
analyzed: las gzhan sgrub pa ni /
translated: As for accomplishing other activities,

original: ro sna tshogs pa'i gtor mas mchod par bya zhing sna tshogs pa'i bdug spos dbul lo //🔽bum pa @117a *//
analyzed: ro sna tshogs pa'i gtor mas mchod par bya zhing sna tshogs pa'i bdug spos dbul lo // bum pa @117a *//
translated: one should make offerings with various food oblations and offer various incense.

original: chus bkang nas rdzas kyi phye ma rnams der gzhug cing /
analyzed: chus bkang nas rdzas kyi phye ma rnams der gzhug cing /
translated: One should fill a vase with water and place in it various powdered substances.

original: rin chen sna bdun bcug ste de la rgya dar gyis bcings la /
analyzed: rin chen sna bdun bcug ste de la rgya dar gyis bcings la /
translated: Having inserted the seven precious substances, it should be bound with silk.

original: don yod zhags pa brgya dang / snying po nyid kyang lan brgyar bzlas so //
analyzed: don yod zhags pa brgya dang / snying po nyid kyang lan brgyar bzlas so //
translated: One should recite the Amogha-pāśa one hundred times, and also the essence mantra one hundred times.

original: yi ge gcig pa brgya rtsa brgyad du bzla'o //
analyzed: yi ge gcig pa brgya rtsa brgyad du bzla'o //
translated: One should recite the one-syllable [mantra] one hundred and eight times.

original: tsandan dang / sa m'i dang / si ri sha dang / hab shang tsi'u dang / gur gum dang / yungs kar dang / padma ge sar rnams legs par btags nas bum pa bkang bar bya ste /
analyzed: tsandan dang / sa m'i dang / si ri sha dang / hab shang tsi'u dang / gur gum dang / yungs kar dang / padma ge sar rnams legs par btags nas bum pa bkang bar bya ste /
translated: Having well mixed sandalwood, nutmeg, śirīṣa, hab-shung-tsi, saffron, white mustard seed, and lotus stamen, one should fill the vase.

original: 'di rnams kyis khrus bya'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyis khrus bya'o //
translated: One should bathe with these.

original: nye'u shing shu ti dang / bil ba ste /
analyzed: nye'u shing shu ti dang / bil ba ste /
translated: One should anoint with Indian licorice, śirīṣa, and bilva.

original: 'di rnams kyis nyed pa dang / rtag tu sngon du byab par byas la /
analyzed: 'di rnams kyis nyed pa dang / rtag tu sngon du byab par byas la /
translated: Having always anointed with these,

original: de nas mkhas pas khrus bya'o //
analyzed: de nas mkhas pas khrus bya'o //
translated: then the wise one should bathe.

original: de nas srung ba'i cho ga ni /
analyzed: de nas srung ba'i cho ga ni /
translated: Then, the rite of protection

original: don yod rgyal pos bya'o //
analyzed: don yod rgyal pos bya'o //
translated: should be done with Amoghavajra.

original: de nas rtsva dur ba bting nas de la skyil mo krung gis 'dug ste bum pa'i chus khrus bya zhing /
analyzed: de nas rtsva dur ba bting nas de la skyil mo krung gis 'dug ste bum pa'i chus khrus bya zhing /
translated: Then, having spread durva grass, one should sit there in the vajra posture and bathe with the vase water.

original: padma'i phyag rgya yang byed du gzhug go /
analyzed: padma'i phyag rgya yang byed du gzhug go /
translated: One should also have the lotus mudrā made.

original: de nas gtsang ma gos gtsang ma bgos te gtsug tor bcing par bya zhing /
analyzed: de nas gtsang ma gos gtsang ma bgos te gtsug tor bcing par bya zhing /
translated: Then, having put on clean clothes and tied up one’s topknot,

original: sngon du bzlas pa 'bul ba dang / bskor ba byas nas sgo dang sgo nas phyag bya'o //
analyzed: sngon du bzlas pa 'bul ba dang / bskor ba byas nas sgo dang sgo nas phyag bya'o //
translated: one should offer a preliminary recitation, circumambulate, and prostrate from door to door.

original: shar gyi sgo ru zhugs la dbus kyi dkyil 'khor gyi snying por skyil krung gis 'dug la /
analyzed: shar gyi sgo ru zhugs la dbus kyi dkyil 'khor gyi snying por skyil krung gis 'dug la /
translated: Having entered through the eastern door, one should sit cross-legged in the center of the maṇḍala and

original: don yod pa'i rgyal pos lan bdun du byab par bya'o //
analyzed: don yod pa'i rgyal pos lan bdun du byab par bya'o //
translated: sweep with the Amogaviṣ kṣetrapāla mantra seven times.

original: lag tu rdo rje dang / bgrang phreng gis mngon par dbang bskur zhing /
analyzed: lag tu rdo rje dang / bgrang phreng gis mngon par dbang bskur zhing /
translated: One should confer the empowerment with the vajra and the rosary in the hand,

original: chu dang / yungs kar dang / phyag rgyas dbang bskur @117b bar bya'o //
analyzed: chu dang / yungs kar dang / phyag rgyas dbang bskur @117b bar bya'o //
translated: and with the water, mustard seeds, and mudrā.

original: de nas dkon mchog gsum la mchod pa bya'o //
analyzed: de nas dkon mchog gsum la mchod pa bya'o //
translated: Then one should make offerings to the Three Jewels.

original: 'di ni / khrus kyi gtso bor 'jig rten dbang phyug gis gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ni / khrus kyi gtso bor 'jig rten dbang phyug gis gsungs so //
translated: This is the principal ablution taught by Lokeśvara.

original: sems can thams cad la phan pa'i don gyi ched dang / rig sngags 'chang rnams la khyad par du sangs rgyas thams cad kyis byin gyis brlabs pa dang / lha thams cad kyis mchod pa dang / don yod pa'i phun sum tshogs pa gdon mi za bar byed do //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la phan pa'i don gyi ched dang / rig sngags 'chang rnams la khyad par du sangs rgyas thams cad kyis byin gyis brlabs pa dang / lha thams cad kyis mchod pa dang / don yod pa'i phun sum tshogs pa gdon mi za bar byed do //
translated: For the sake of benefiting all sentient beings, and in particular for the vidyādharas, it is blessed by all the buddhas, worshipped by all the gods, and undoubtedly accomplishes all that is meaningful.

original: gang dang gang du las la nges par sbyar ba thams cad du don yod pa'i dngos grub thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang dang gang du las la nges par sbyar ba thams cad du don yod pa'i dngos grub thob par 'gyur te /
translated: Wherever one is definitely employed in ritual action, one will attain the accomplishment of the unfailing [means].

original: thams cad du 'di la the tshom med do //
analyzed: thams cad du 'di la the tshom med do //
translated: In all cases, there is no doubt about this.

original: sngags kyi dngos grub bla na med pa ma grub pa yang grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sngags kyi dngos grub bla na med pa ma grub pa yang grub par 'gyur te /
translated: Even if the unsurpassed accomplishment of mantra has not been attained, it will be attained.

original: don yod pa'i dngos grub thob cing 'phral nyid du 'bras bu mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: don yod pa'i dngos grub thob cing 'phral nyid du 'bras bu mthong ba yin no //
translated: One will attain the accomplishment of the unfailing [means] and immediately see the result.

original: lus yongs su dag cing shin tu dri ma med pa dang / legs par khrus byas par de brjod par bya'o //🔽sdig pa thams cad nyams par byed pa /
analyzed: lus yongs su dag cing shin tu dri ma med pa dang / legs par khrus byas par de brjod par bya'o // sdig pa thams cad nyams par byed pa /
translated: One's body will be purified and extremely stainless, and one will be well-bathed. This should be stated.🔽It destroys all evil.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad zad par byed pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad zad par byed pa /
translated: It exhausts all afflictions.

original: nad thams cad las yongs su grol bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: nad thams cad las yongs su grol bar byed pa ste /
translated: It completely frees from all illnesses.

original: mdor na thams cad du dngos grub so sor rnyed cing /
analyzed: mdor na thams cad du dngos grub so sor rnyed cing /
translated: In brief, one will obtain each and every power everywhere.

original: dpal chen por lhag par 'gro'o //
analyzed: dpal chen por lhag par 'gro'o //
translated: One will go to a great and glorious [state].

original: rig sngags don du gnyer ba thob ste /🔽rig sngags don yod pa'i dngos grub kyi de kho na nyid las bu 'dod pas ni /
analyzed: rig sngags don du gnyer ba thob ste / rig sngags don yod pa'i dngos grub kyi de kho na nyid las bu 'dod pas ni /
translated: One will obtain the desired knowledge-mantra.

original: bu thob bo //🔽nor 'dod pas ni /
analyzed: bu thob bo // nor 'dod pas ni /
translated: From the reality of the power of the knowledge-mantra, one who desires a son will obtain a son.

original: nor thob bo //🔽dbang phyug 'dod pas ni /
analyzed: nor thob bo // dbang phyug 'dod pas ni /
translated: One who desires wealth will obtain wealth.

original: dbang phyug thob bo //🔽myur du dpal @118a *//🔽'dod pas ni /
analyzed: dbang phyug thob bo // myur du dpal @118a *// 'dod pas ni /
translated: One who desires power will obtain power.

original: dpal thob bo //
analyzed: dpal thob bo //
translated: One who desires glory will quickly obtain glory.

original: mngon par 'dod pa thams cad 'phral du yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa thams cad 'phral du yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: One who desires all that is wished for will immediately obtain complete fulfillment.

original: zhes so // khrus kyi dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga'o ////
analyzed: zhes so // khrus kyi dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga'o ////
translated: This is the ritual of the bathing mandala.

original: de nas nor bu'i sgrub thabs kyi cho ga dang / dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas nor bu'i sgrub thabs kyi cho ga dang / dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga bshad par bya ste /
translated: Next, I will explain the ritual of the jewel practice and the ritual of the mandala.

original: yid bzhin gyi nor bu'i sgrub pa rmad du byung ba /
analyzed: yid bzhin gyi nor bu'i sgrub pa rmad du byung ba /
translated: The marvelous practice of the wish-fulfilling jewel.

original: don yod pa'i nor bu'i dngos grub dang / bya ba thams cad sgrub par byed pa /
analyzed: don yod pa'i nor bu'i dngos grub dang / bya ba thams cad sgrub par byed pa /
translated: the accomplishment of the wish-fulfilling jewel, and the accomplishment of all activities.

original: thams cad du ltung ba'i sdug bsngal las byung ba'i 'jigs pa thams cad las skyob par byed pa /
analyzed: thams cad du ltung ba'i sdug bsngal las byung ba'i 'jigs pa thams cad las skyob par byed pa /
translated: It protects from all fears arising from the suffering of falling into all lower realms.

original: bsod nams thob pa mngon par thar par byed pa /
analyzed: bsod nams thob pa mngon par thar par byed pa /
translated: It causes the attainment of merit and liberation.

original: mtshon cha dang / khong sgril gcog par byed par the tshom med do //
analyzed: mtshon cha dang / khong sgril gcog par byed par the tshom med do //
translated: It undoubtedly shatters weapons and clubs.

original: sdig pa thams cad rnam par nyams par byed pa /
analyzed: sdig pa thams cad rnam par nyams par byed pa /
translated: It destroys all evil.

original: mtshams med pa zad par byed pa /
analyzed: mtshams med pa zad par byed pa /
translated: It exhausts the five acts of immediate retribution.

original: rtag tu gsod pa med pa'i gnas thams cad du son par byed pa /
analyzed: rtag tu gsod pa med pa'i gnas thams cad du son par byed pa /
translated: It always causes one to reach all the places where there is no killing.

original: rtag tu 'khrugs pa dang / g-yul ngo las rgyal ba sbyin par 'gyur ro //🔽chom rkun gyi nang nas grol bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: rtag tu 'khrugs pa dang / g-yul ngo las rgyal ba sbyin par 'gyur ro // chom rkun gyi nang nas grol bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: It always grants victory in disputes and battles.🔽It liberates from thieves.

original: rkun mo las kyang sgrol bar byed do //
analyzed: rkun mo las kyang sgrol bar byed do //
translated: It also liberates from robbers.

original: gcan gzan gtum po seng+ge dang / glang po che dang / dom dang / gzig dang / dred dang / khyi dang / phag dang / lce spyang rnams las nor bu'i rgyal po gang du gnas pa'i mod la thams cad du sgrol bar byed do //
analyzed: gcan gzan gtum po seng+ge dang / glang po che dang / dom dang / gzig dang / dred dang / khyi dang / phag dang / lce spyang rnams las nor bu'i rgyal po gang du gnas pa'i mod la thams cad du sgrol bar byed do //
translated: The fierce beasts, lions, elephants, bears, leopards, hyenas, dogs, pigs, and jackals, wherever the king of jewels is, all are liberated.

original: dug dang / sbrul thams cad dam /
analyzed: dug dang / sbrul thams cad dam /
translated: All poisons, all snakes,

original: mche ba gdug pa dang / sbrul @118b go na sa dang / ba ta sa n'a bha dang / dug nyid dang / dug shring+ga dang / dug mu sta ka nyid dang / dar da'i dug dang / lus la byas pa dang / mi bzad pa'i dug dang /
analyzed: mche ba gdug pa dang / sbrul @118b go na sa dang / ba ta sa n'a bha dang / dug nyid dang / dug shring+ga dang / dug mu sta ka nyid dang / dar da'i dug dang / lus la byas pa dang / mi bzad pa'i dug dang /
translated: all fangs, all poisonous snakes, all poisonous plants, all poisons, all poisonous herbs, all poisons, all poisons in the body, all terrible poisons,

original: dug ha la ha la dang / sdig  pa la sogs pa gang yin pa dang / mthong ba'i dug gang yin pa dang / dbugs kyi dug mi bzad pa gang yin pa dang / reg pa'i dug 'jigs pa dang / 'jog pos kyang zin pa dang /
analyzed: dug ha la ha la dang / sdig  pa la sogs pa gang yin pa dang / mthong ba'i dug gang yin pa dang / dbugs kyi dug mi bzad pa gang yin pa dang / reg pa'i dug 'jigs pa dang / 'jog pos kyang zin pa dang /
translated: all hālāhala poisons, all poisons of scorpions and so on, all poisons of sight, all terrible poisonous breaths, all terrible poisons of touch, all poisons of the grahas,

original: gzhan yang srog chags mi bzad pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i dug mi bzad pa rnams dkyil 'khor mthong ba tsam dang / nor bu reg pa tsam gyis de rnams thams cad 'phral du dug med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang srog chags mi bzad pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i dug mi bzad pa rnams dkyil 'khor mthong ba tsam dang / nor bu reg pa tsam gyis de rnams thams cad 'phral du dug med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, by merely seeing the maṇḍala and merely touching the jewel, all the unbearable poisons of various unbearable creatures will be immediately destroyed.

original: gal te gang gar 'bab pa'i dug 'thungs kyang 'phral du 'joms par byed do //
analyzed: gal te gang gar 'bab pa'i dug 'thungs kyang 'phral du 'joms par byed do //
translated: If one drinks poison that has been enchanted, it will be destroyed immediately.

original: nam mkha' lding gis sbrul nyid dang klu bzhin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' lding gis sbrul nyid dang klu bzhin no //
translated: Like a garuḍa for snakes and nāgas.

original: mes mi 'tshig go /
analyzed: mes mi 'tshig go /
translated: One will not be burned by fire.

original: slar yang chus 'khyer bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: slar yang chus 'khyer bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, one will not be carried away by water.

original: byi ba kha gdug pa'i 'jigs pa mi 'byung /
analyzed: byi ba kha gdug pa'i 'jigs pa mi 'byung /
translated: The fear of a mouse’s bite will not occur.

original: de la rgyal po khro bar mi byed do //
analyzed: de la rgyal po khro bar mi byed do //
translated: The king will not be angry with one.

original: nam yang phyir rgol ba dang / dgra dang / 'thab mo dang / 'khrul 'khor byed pa dang / sdang pa gang yin pa de rnams med de /
analyzed: nam yang phyir rgol ba dang / dgra dang / 'thab mo dang / 'khrul 'khor byed pa dang / sdang pa gang yin pa de rnams med de /
translated: One will never have any enemies, adversaries, quarrels, disputes, or hatred.

original: cho ga 'di ni /
analyzed: cho ga 'di ni /
translated: This rite

original: mchog go / dug dang / byad stems dang / phye ma'i sbyor ba la sogs pa thams cad skad cig de la nyams par byed do //
analyzed: mchog go / dug dang / byad stems dang / phye ma'i sbyor ba la sogs pa thams cad skad cig de la nyams par byed do //
translated: All poisons, spells, and magical powders, etc. are destroyed in that very moment.

original: gnod sbyin dang / srin po dang / 'byung po dang / yi dvags dang / skem byed dang / brjed byed dang / gsang ba pa dang / bgegs @119a *//
analyzed: gnod sbyin dang / srin po dang / 'byung po dang / yi dvags dang / skem byed dang / brjed byed dang / gsang ba pa dang / bgegs @119a *//
translated: Yakshas, rakshasas, bhutas, pretas, unmadas, apasmāras, guhyakas, vighnas,

original: dang / log 'dren rnams dkyil 'khor mthong ba tsam dang / nor bu bzung ba nyid kyis thams cad 'bros par byed de /
analyzed: dang / log 'dren rnams dkyil 'khor mthong ba tsam dang / nor bu bzung ba nyid kyis thams cad 'bros par byed de /
translated: and kaṭapūtanas flee merely by seeing the maṇḍala and holding the jewel.

original: 'di la the tshom med do //🔽'di thams cad kyis thun mong du nor bu'i dkyil 'khor mthong ba la /
analyzed: 'di la the tshom med do // 'di thams cad kyis thun mong du nor bu'i dkyil 'khor mthong ba la /
translated: There is no doubt about this.🔽All of these are common.

original: bsam pa gang yin pa'i bsam pa de thams cad yid la don du gnyer bar bya ba gang yin pa rnams kyang nor bu bzung ba nyid la thams cad myur du phun sum tshogs par byed do //
analyzed: bsam pa gang yin pa'i bsam pa de thams cad yid la don du gnyer bar bya ba gang yin pa rnams kyang nor bu bzung ba nyid la thams cad myur du phun sum tshogs par byed do //
translated: Whatever wish is desired by seeing the maṇḍala of the jewel, and whatever aim is sought, all will be quickly accomplished by merely holding the jewel.

original: tshe 'phel ba dang / sngags kyi dngos grub bla na med pa 'grub bo //
analyzed: tshe 'phel ba dang / sngags kyi dngos grub bla na med pa 'grub bo //
translated: It increases lifespan and accomplishes the unsurpassed siddhi of mantra.

original: bkra shis pa dang / dam pa dang / bsod nams dang / dag pa dang / sdig pa nyams pa dang / rmi lam ngan pa nyams pa dang / 'phral du rmi lam bzang por byed pa nyid dang / rtag tu sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' mthong ba dang /
analyzed: bkra shis pa dang / dam pa dang / bsod nams dang / dag pa dang / sdig pa nyams pa dang / rmi lam ngan pa nyams pa dang / 'phral du rmi lam bzang por byed pa nyid dang / rtag tu sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' mthong ba dang /
translated: It brings good fortune, excellence, merit, purity, the destruction of evil, the destruction of bad dreams, good dreams right away, and the constant vision of buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: rtag tu lha rnams 'gugs pa nyid dang / rtag tu 'byor pa thams cad byed pa dang / rtag tu zla ba nya ba ltar 'od zer 'bar bas rnam par mdzes pa dang / tshig btsun pa dang / rtag tu dga' ba dang / thams cad du mchod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtag tu lha rnams 'gugs pa nyid dang / rtag tu 'byor pa thams cad byed pa dang / rtag tu zla ba nya ba ltar 'od zer 'bar bas rnam par mdzes pa dang / tshig btsun pa dang / rtag tu dga' ba dang / thams cad du mchod par bya ba'o //
translated: It always attracts gods, always accomplishes all goals, always shines with blazing light like the full moon, brings pure speech, constant joy, and is always to be worshipped by all.

original: de nas rig sngags 'chang gis rdzas kyi sbyor ba bya ste /

translated: [One should] mix all of these well, make them into a powder, and finally combine them all into one, mixing them with honey.

original: tshes bco lnga la rgyu skar dang / tshes grangs kyi lha dge ba la rig sngags 'chang gtsang mar gyur pas gos gtsang ma bgos te legs par khrus byas par gyur pas brtul zhugs spyad pas bdug pa'i mchog sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshes bco lnga la rgyu skar dang / tshes grangs kyi lha dge ba la rig sngags 'chang gtsang mar gyur pas gos gtsang ma bgos te legs par khrus byas par gyur pas brtul zhugs spyad pas bdug pa'i mchog sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: On the fifteenth day, under a virtuous lunar mansion and lunar day of the deity, the knowledge-mantra holder, having become pure, dressed in clean clothes, having bathed well, having practiced discipline, should apply the supreme incense.

original: de nas bdug pa'i rgyal po sgrub pa'i dkyil 'khor gru bzhi pa tshad shin tu rnam par phye ba bya ste /
analyzed: de nas bdug pa'i rgyal po sgrub pa'i dkyil 'khor gru bzhi pa tshad shin tu rnam par phye ba bya ste /
translated: Then, one should make a square maṇḍala for accomplishing the king of incenses, very well divided in size,

original: gzings kyi tshad kyi shin tu bcags pa /
analyzed: gzings kyi tshad kyi shin tu bcags pa /
translated: very well smoothed to the size of a raft,

original: 'jam zhing bsnyen pa la tshon rnam pa sna tshogs pas sgo bzhi shin tu rnam par phye ba mdzes par bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'jam zhing bsnyen pa la tshon rnam pa sna tshogs pas sgo bzhi shin tu rnam par phye ba mdzes par bri bar bya'o //
translated: smooth and even, with four well-divided doors, beautifully painted with various colors.

original: dbus kyi dkyil 'khor gyi snying por padma'i phreng ba bri'o //
analyzed: dbus kyi dkyil 'khor gyi snying por padma'i phreng ba bri'o //
translated: In the center of the maṇḍala, one should draw a garland of lotuses.

original: dbus kyi padma phyed kha bye ba'i phreng ba bri ste /
analyzed: dbus kyi padma phyed kha bye ba'i phreng ba bri ste /
translated: One should draw a garland of half-open lotuses in the center.

original: lag pa gnyis thon nas sna tshogs pa'i sprin 'khrigs pa 'dzin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: lag pa gnyis thon nas sna tshogs pa'i sprin 'khrigs pa 'dzin par byed pa'o //
translated: They emerge from both hands and hold various clouds.

original: de'i steng du bdug pa'i snod bkong nas me'i kha dog can gyi gos kyis g-yogs la /
analyzed: de'i steng du bdug pa'i snod bkong nas me'i kha dog can gyi gos kyis g-yogs la /
translated: Above that, one should fill an incense burner with charcoal, cover it with a cloth the color of fire,

original: dkyil 'khor gyi gra bzhin rnams su rlung gi rgyal po bri'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi gra bzhin rnams su rlung gi rgyal po bri'o //
translated: and draw the kings of the wind in the four corners of the maṇḍala.

original: sgo bzhir zhags pa bris nas khor yug tu lag pa'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: sgo bzhir zhags pa bris nas khor yug tu lag pa'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: Having drawn a noose in the four doors, one should draw the hand gestures all around.

original: padma'i phreng ba las nges par thon pa'o //
analyzed: padma'i phreng ba las nges par thon pa'o //
translated: They emerge from the garland of lotuses.

original: bdug spos 'khyil ba 'ching bar byed pa dkyil 'khor gyi steng du spras par bya'o //
analyzed: bdug spos 'khyil ba 'ching bar byed pa dkyil 'khor gyi steng du spras par bya'o //
translated: One should adorn the top of the maṇḍala with a bound swirling incense burner.

original: ji ltar 'byor pa'i gtor ma dang @125b me tog dbul bar bya /
analyzed: ji ltar 'byor pa'i gtor ma dang @125b me tog dbul bar bya /
translated: One should offer oblations and flowers according to one’s means.

original: mchod yon gyi snod dang / gang ba'i bum pa dang / ba dan dang / rgyan dang / skyud pa dmar pos mtshams bcings pa dang / dkyil 'khor la dngul dang / gser gzhag cing /
analyzed: mchod yon gyi snod dang / gang ba'i bum pa dang / ba dan dang / rgyan dang / skyud pa dmar pos mtshams bcings pa dang / dkyil 'khor la dngul dang / gser gzhag cing /
translated: The vessel for the libation, the full vase, the banner, the ornaments, the red tassels that bind the boundaries, and the silver and gold placed in the maṇḍala.

original: khor yug tu mar me'i phreng ba dang / dri sna tshogs rgya chen po'o //
analyzed: khor yug tu mar me'i phreng ba dang / dri sna tshogs rgya chen po'o //
translated: The garland of lamps all around, and the various extensive fragrances.

original: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug bkod nas kha shar du phyogs nas padma'i phreng ba la nye bar dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug bkod nas kha shar du phyogs nas padma'i phreng ba la nye bar dgod par bya'o //
translated: Having arranged the noble Avalokiteśvara, facing east, he should be placed in the garland of lotuses.

original: de nas rig sngags 'chang gis bdug pa'i rgyal po la yongs su bzla bar bya ste /
analyzed: de nas rig sngags 'chang gis bdug pa'i rgyal po la yongs su bzla bar bya ste /
translated: Then the knowledge-holder should recite the sovereign incense.

original: nyi ma bdun la thun gsum du don yod pa'i rgyal po brgya rtsa brgyad bzla zhing snying po brgya rtsa brgyad bzla'o //🔽don yod pa'i snying po yi ge gcig pa'i bzlas brjod 'bum rdzogs pa ste /🔽stong phrag brgya rdzogs pa ni /
analyzed: nyi ma bdun la thun gsum du don yod pa'i rgyal po brgya rtsa brgyad bzla zhing snying po brgya rtsa brgyad bzla'o // don yod pa'i snying po yi ge gcig pa'i bzlas brjod 'bum rdzogs pa ste / stong phrag brgya rdzogs pa ni /
translated: For seven days, in three sessions, he should recite the king Amogha eight hundred times, and recite the essence mantra eight hundred times.🔽The recitation of the one-syllable essence of Amogha is complete.

original: bzlas brjod kyi cho ga'o //
analyzed: bzlas brjod kyi cho ga'o //
translated: The completion of one hundred thousand recitations is the ritual of recitation.

original: de nas 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la mchod pa bya zhing /
analyzed: de nas 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la mchod pa bya zhing /
translated: Then one should make offerings to Ārya Avalokiteśvara.

original: slar yang don yod pa'i rgyal po'i bzlas brjod nyi shu rtsa gcig dang / khro bo'i rgyal po'i bzlas brjod nyi shu rtsa gcig bya'o //
analyzed: slar yang don yod pa'i rgyal po'i bzlas brjod nyi shu rtsa gcig dang / khro bo'i rgyal po'i bzlas brjod nyi shu rtsa gcig bya'o //
translated: Again, one should recite the mantra of Amoghapāśa twenty-one times and the mantra of Krodharāja twenty-one times.

original: de nas thog mar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la bdug pa dbul bar bya /
analyzed: de nas thog mar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la bdug pa dbul bar bya /
translated: Then, first one should offer incense to the Blessed Buddha.

original: de nas 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la bdug pa dbul lo //
analyzed: de nas 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la bdug pa dbul lo //
translated: Then one should offer incense to Ārya Avalokiteśvara.

original: 'di ni / bdug pa sgrub pa'i cho ga grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ni / bdug pa sgrub pa'i cho ga grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is the accomplishment of the incense rite.

original: bdug pa'i rgyal po 'dis bya ba de sgrub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdug pa'i rgyal po 'dis bya ba de sgrub par 'gyur ro //
translated: This incense king will accomplish that activity.

original: gal te rig sngags 'chang gis yungs @126a *//
analyzed: gal te rig sngags 'chang gis yungs @126a *//
translated: If the knowledge-holder uses mustard

original: kar gyi 'bras bu gcig gi tshad tsam gyi bdug pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mchod par 'dod pa dang / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams dri gcig gis rgyas par 'dod pa dang / bdug pa'i sprin 'khrigs pas kun nas g-yogs par 'dod pa dang /
analyzed: kar gyi 'bras bu gcig gi tshad tsam gyi bdug pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mchod par 'dod pa dang / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams dri gcig gis rgyas par 'dod pa dang / bdug pa'i sprin 'khrigs pas kun nas g-yogs par 'dod pa dang /
translated: if one wishes to be enveloped in a mass of incense clouds,

original: dri sna tshogs pa'i char 'bebs par byed par 'dod pa des bdug pa'i rgyal pos bdug pa de /
analyzed: dri sna tshogs pa'i char 'bebs par byed par 'dod pa des bdug pa'i rgyal pos bdug pa de /
translated: and if one wishes to cause a rain of various fragrances to fall,

original: rig sngags 'chang gis rtag tu rgyun mi 'chang par mngon par brtson par bya'o //
analyzed: rig sngags 'chang gis rtag tu rgyun mi 'chang par mngon par brtson par bya'o //
translated: that master of awareness should always strive to offer incense with this king of incenses.

original: de nas rig sngags 'chang gis nyi ma re re zhing sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dang / 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi spyan sngar dkyil 'khor byas la me tog gcal du bkram par bya'o; ;mchod yon dang / zhabs bsil yang gzhag par bya /
analyzed: de nas rig sngags 'chang gis nyi ma re re zhing sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dang / 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi spyan sngar dkyil 'khor byas la me tog gcal du bkram par bya'o; ;mchod yon dang / zhabs bsil yang gzhag par bya /
translated: “Then, the master of awareness should make a maṇḍala every day in front of the blessed buddhas and noble Avalokiteśvara, strew it with flowers, and set out water for drinking and for washing.

original: bdug pa'i rgyal po 'dis bdug par bya zhing /
analyzed: bdug pa'i rgyal po 'dis bdug par bya zhing /
translated: He should offer incense with this king of incenses.

original: don yod pa'i rgyal po dus gcig tu brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: don yod pa'i rgyal po dus gcig tu brjod par bya ste /
translated: The king of Amogha [means] to be spoken of at one time.

original: phyogs bcur bdug pa'i pog phor dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: phyogs bcur bdug pa'i pog phor dbul bar bya'o //
translated: Offer incense burners in the ten directions.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad yid la byed par 'gyur ba dang / sems can 'byung po thams cad la byams pa bsgom par bya /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad yid la byed par 'gyur ba dang / sems can 'byung po thams cad la byams pa bsgom par bya /
translated: One should meditate on all the Tathagatas, and cultivate love for all sentient beings.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing du gtogs pa thams cad dri ma med pa'i sems kyis yid la bsgom par bya /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing du gtogs pa thams cad dri ma med pa'i sems kyis yid la bsgom par bya /
translated: One should meditate on all the Buddha-fields with a stainless mind.

original: dkyil 'khor la me tog dang / bdug @126b pa dang / mchod yon dang / zhabs bsil phul te yi ge gcig pa yid la brjod cing /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor la me tog dang / bdug @126b pa dang / mchod yon dang / zhabs bsil phul te yi ge gcig pa yid la brjod cing /
translated: Having offered flowers, incense, water for welcoming, and water for refreshing the feet to the maṇḍala, one should recite the one-syllable [mantra] in the mind.

original: phyag rgya yang lan gcig bcings la phyag bya'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya yang lan gcig bcings la phyag bya'o //
translated: Having formed the mudrā once, one should pay homage.

original: zhes so // phul ba tsam gyi mod la phyogs re re zhing gang+g'a'i klung gi bye ma khrag khrig brgya stong phrag dgu bcu rtsa dgu'i sangs rgyas bye ba la dris khyab par byed cing /
analyzed: zhes so // phul ba tsam gyi mod la phyogs re re zhing gang+g'a'i klung gi bye ma khrag khrig brgya stong phrag dgu bcu rtsa dgu'i sangs rgyas bye ba la dris khyab par byed cing /
translated: As soon as it is offered, one should pervade the ten directions with the sound of the one-syllable [mantra], and the ten directions will be filled with the light of the one-syllable [mantra].

original: bdug pa chen po 'khrigs pas nam mkha'i mthil du khyab par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdug pa chen po 'khrigs pas nam mkha'i mthil du khyab par 'gyur ro //
translated: The great incense will spread and pervade the entire sky.

original: dri sna tshogs kyi char 'bab par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dri sna tshogs kyi char 'bab par 'gyur te /
translated: A rain of various fragrances will fall.

original: bcom ldan 'das mchod pa'i las sangs rgyas kyi zhing re re zhing gang+g'a'i klung gi bye ma khrag khrig brgya stong phrag phye ba dgu bcu rtsa dgu'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la mchod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mchod pa'i las sangs rgyas kyi zhing re re zhing gang+g'a'i klung gi bye ma khrag khrig brgya stong phrag phye ba dgu bcu rtsa dgu'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la mchod par 'gyur ro //
translated: The Blessed One will perform the activity of worship in each buddha field, worshiping the Blessed Buddhas of ninety-nine sextillion Ganges river sand grains.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mchod pas de bzhin gshegs pa de rnams thams cad rig sngags 'chang la dus su don yod pa'i rgyal po dran par byed pa bsrung ba'i don dang / phyag rgya 'ching bar byed pa de bsrung ba'i don du legs so zhes bya ba'i sgra rjod par byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mchod pas de bzhin gshegs pa de rnams thams cad rig sngags 'chang la dus su don yod pa'i rgyal po dran par byed pa bsrung ba'i don dang / phyag rgya 'ching bar byed pa de bsrung ba'i don du legs so zhes bya ba'i sgra rjod par byed do //
translated: By worshipping all the Tathagatas, all those Tathagatas will, in time, remember the Amogha King for the sake of protecting the knowledge-holder, and will utter the sound of Excellent for the sake of protecting the one who forms the mudra.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad byams pa rgyas par byed pa de bzhin du bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad byams pa rgyas par byed pa de bzhin du bya'o //
translated: One should act in the same way as all the Tathagatas, expanding their love.

original: don yod pa chen po'i dngos grub kyang sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: don yod pa chen po'i dngos grub kyang sbyin par byed do //
translated: He will also grant the great accomplishment of Amogha.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de rnams kyi drung du bsod nams kyi tshogs chen po nye bar gsog par byed do //🔽de bzhin gshegs pa re re zhing bye ba @127a *//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de rnams kyi drung du bsod nams kyi tshogs chen po nye bar gsog par byed do // de bzhin gshegs pa re re zhing bye ba @127a *//
translated: In the presence of those Tathāgatas, he will accumulate a great heap of merit.

original: brgya stong phrag gi drung du bsod nams kyi phung po dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba nye bar gsog par byed do //
analyzed: brgya stong phrag gi drung du bsod nams kyi phung po dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba nye bar gsog par byed do //
translated: In the presence of each Tathāgata, he will accumulate a heap of merit and roots of virtue equal to that of a hundred thousand koṭis of Tathāgatas.

original: ji ltar rig sngags 'chang de bzhin gshegs pa mchod pa'i cho ga byed byed pa de bzhin du rnam pa du ma de bzhin gshegs pa re re zhing gi spyan sngar rab tu 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar rig sngags 'chang de bzhin gshegs pa mchod pa'i cho ga byed byed pa de bzhin du rnam pa du ma de bzhin gshegs pa re re zhing gi spyan sngar rab tu 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as the mantra practitioner performs the ritual of offering to the Tathāgatas, in the same way, in the presence of each Tathāgata, he will go forth in many ways.

original: rig sngags 'chang nyi ma bdun du rab tu brtson pas de bzhin gshegs pa dang / bla ma mchod do //
analyzed: rig sngags 'chang nyi ma bdun du rab tu brtson pas de bzhin gshegs pa dang / bla ma mchod do //
translated: The mantra practitioner, striving for seven days, will make offerings to the Tathāgatas and the gurus.

original: phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mngon sum du mthong ba stsol bar byed do //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mngon sum du mthong ba stsol bar byed do //
translated: He will be granted the direct vision of all the Tathāgatas of the ten directions.

original: de rnams thams cad kyis dbugs 'byin par byed la mchog rab tu stsol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rnams thams cad kyis dbugs 'byin par byed la mchog rab tu stsol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will all grant him relief and bestow the supreme.

original: don yod pa'i dngos grub rjes su stsol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don yod pa'i dngos grub rjes su stsol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He will be granted the accomplishment of Amogha.

original: phyir mi ldog pa la rab tu gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa la rab tu gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will be established in the state of non-regression.

original: sa bcu yang dag par gnon te mngon par shes pa lngar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa bcu yang dag par gnon te mngon par shes pa lngar 'gyur ro //
translated: He will traverse the ten grounds and attain the five superknowledges.

original: 'jig rten pa'i bdug pa sgrub pa'i cho ga'o ////
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i bdug pa sgrub pa'i cho ga'o ////
translated: The worldly rite for accomplishing incense.

original: de bzhin nyid du 'jig rten las 'das pa la 'chi 'pho ba na de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyan snga'i zhabs drung du padma la brdzus te skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid du 'jig rten las 'das pa la 'chi 'pho ba na de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyan snga'i zhabs drung du padma la brdzus te skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, when he passes beyond the world, he will be miraculously born from a lotus at the feet of the Tathāgatas.

original: tshe rabs dran par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshe rabs dran par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: He will remember his past lives.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing gang dang gang du 'gro bar byed pa de thams cad du yang de bzhin gshegs pas rig sngags 'chang la lung ston @127b par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing gang dang gang du 'gro bar byed pa de thams cad du yang de bzhin gshegs pas rig sngags 'chang la lung ston @127b par 'gyur ro //
translated: In whatever buddhafield of the Tathāgatas he goes, there the Tathāgatas will prophesy the knowledge-mantra holder.

original: phyis kyang skye ba gzhan du skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyis kyang skye ba gzhan du skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Later, he will not be reborn again.

original: lus 'di nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la bsnyen bkur nas bde ba can gyi 'jig rten gyi khams su song ste sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar byed do //
analyzed: lus 'di nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la bsnyen bkur nas bde ba can gyi 'jig rten gyi khams su song ste sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar byed do //
translated: Having served all the Tathāgatas with this very body, he goes to the world system Sukhāvatī and turns the wheel of Dharma of the Blessed Buddhas.

original: tshe dpag tu med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshe dpag tu med par 'gyur ro //
translated: He becomes immeasurable life.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa tshe dpag tu med pa ji lta ba de bzhin du 'di'i rdzu 'phrul dang / rnam par 'phrul pa'i khyad par so sor thob bo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa tshe dpag tu med pa ji lta ba de bzhin du 'di'i rdzu 'phrul dang / rnam par 'phrul pa'i khyad par so sor thob bo //
translated: Just like the Tathāgata Amitāyus, he attains the special qualities of his magical power and miracles.

original: 'di ni / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bdug pa sgrub pa'i khyad par ro ////
analyzed: 'di ni / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bdug pa sgrub pa'i khyad par ro ////
translated: This is the special attainment of the supramundane incense.

original: de nas 'jig rten pa'i bdug pa sgrub pa'i cho ga brgya stong phrag du ma 'grub par byed do //
analyzed: de nas 'jig rten pa'i bdug pa sgrub pa'i cho ga brgya stong phrag du ma 'grub par byed do //
translated: Then, he accomplishes the many hundreds of thousands of worldly incense rites.

original: ji ltar ji ltar bdug pa nyid yid la byed pa de lta de ltar thams cad yang dag par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar ji ltar bdug pa nyid yid la byed pa de lta de ltar thams cad yang dag par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Whatever incense he imagines, all that he will accomplish.

original: klu'i gnas su bdugs na /
analyzed: klu'i gnas su bdugs na /
translated: If he fumigates the abode of the nāgas,

original: bdugs pa tsam gyi mod la klu'i rgyal pos char rgyun chen po 'byin par byed do //
analyzed: bdugs pa tsam gyi mod la klu'i rgyal pos char rgyun chen po 'byin par byed do //
translated: The moment it is wafted, the nāga king will send down a great rain.

original: rgyal po'i sgor bdugs na /
analyzed: rgyal po'i sgor bdugs na /
translated: If one wafts it at the king’s gate,

original: rgyal po dang / btsun mo'i 'khor g-yog dang bcas pa dbang du gyur nas gnas so //
analyzed: rgyal po dang / btsun mo'i 'khor g-yog dang bcas pa dbang du gyur nas gnas so //
translated: the king, the queen, and the retinue will be under one’s control and will remain so.

original: skye bo mang po'i dbus su bdugs na /
analyzed: skye bo mang po'i dbus su bdugs na /
translated: If one wafts it in the midst of a great crowd of people,

original: rigs bzhi'i 'jig rten dbang du gyur nas gnas so //
analyzed: rigs bzhi'i 'jig rten dbang du gyur nas gnas so //
translated: the world with its four castes will be under one’s control and will remain so.

original: bdag nyid la bdugs na /
analyzed: bdag nyid la bdugs na /
translated: If one wafts it on oneself,

original: thams cad du mchod pa'i 'os chen por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad du mchod pa'i 'os chen por 'gyur ro //
translated: one will become a great object of worship for all.

original: nad thams cad la bdugs na /
analyzed: nad thams cad la bdugs na /
translated: If one wafts it on all the sick,

original: nad thams cad yongs su grol bar byed do //
analyzed: nad thams cad yongs su grol bar byed do //
translated: they will be completely cured of all illnesses.

original: dug la bdugs na /
analyzed: dug la bdugs na /
translated: If one wafts it on poison,

original: dug med par @128a *//
analyzed: dug med par @128a *//
translated: the poison will be neutralized.

original: 'gyur ro // mtshams kyi nang du bdugs na /
analyzed: 'gyur ro // mtshams kyi nang du bdugs na /

original: the tshom @131a *//

analyzed: rtag tu yang mthong ba stsol bar mdzad do //

analyzed: til mar de ni snod gtsang ma //

original: smig ma'i snod du gzhag par bya //

analyzed: srung ba'i cho ga dang / nye reg bya ba dang / gos bgo ba dang / mchod phyir thogs pa ste /

analyzed: legs par bkrus pa; sbyangs pa / phye ma zhib tu btags pa /

analyzed: thal ba lta bu la brgyad stong bzlas brjod byas nas snod dgang /

analyzed: dbus kyi dkyil 'khor dam pa'i steng du so sor gzhag go /

analyzed: gang gi tshe don du bya ba byung ba'i tshe bya ba thams cad byed do // gser ram / yang na dngul lam /

analyzed: gang gi tshe don du bya ba byung ba de'i tshe las thams cad grub pa ston to //

analyzed: gzhan ni / bla ma la gus shing /

analyzed: sangs rgyas chos la ston byed pa //
translated: who are teachers of the Buddha’s Dharma,🔽who have faith in the assembly of noble ones,

analyzed: 'phags pa'i tshogs la dad pa dang // byams sems snying rje'i bdag nyid can //

analyzed: de yi lag tu rab tu sbyin //

analyzed: bdag gi srog bzhin gtad par bya //

analyzed: 'gro ba lam ni bde bar 'gro /

original: gang na 'od dpag med pa bzhugs //
analyzed: gang na 'od dpag med pa bzhugs //

original: bde ba can du rtag tu 'gro //
analyzed: bde ba can du rtag tu 'gro //

analyzed: brdzus te skyes te padma las // rgyan rtags @154a *//

analyzed: phyag na rdo rje'i sku gzugs la mchod pa yang bya /

analyzed: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la aa ga ru'i bdug spos kyis bdug /

analyzed: lag na rdo rje la gu gul gyi bdug spos kyis bdug /

analyzed: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la lha bshos dkar po dbul /

analyzed: lag na rdo rje la ro sna tshogs dang ldan pa'i lha bshos phul la nyin par don yod pa'i rgyal po bzlas brjod bya /

analyzed: mtshan mor khro bo'i rgyal po ngal ba med par bzlas brjod bya ste /

original: lag na @154b rdo rje yang pus mo 'dzugs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: lag na @154b rdo rje yang pus mo 'dzugs par 'gyur te /

analyzed: de gnyis kyi mig nas 'dzag pa rig sngags 'chang gis blangs nas thig le byas na mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The vidyādhara should take the oozing from their eyes and make a bindu of it. He will become invisible.

original: mig la bskus na; nam mkha' la 'gro'o //
analyzed: mig la bskus na; nam mkha' la 'gro'o //
translated: If he anoints his eyes with it, he will fly through the sky.

original: khar bcug na /
analyzed: khar bcug na /
translated: If he puts it in his mouth,

analyzed: rig sngags dang / cho ga zhib mo dang / gsang sngags dang / dkyil 'khor mngon du 'gyur ro //

analyzed: lag na rdo rje'i stobs dang / shugs dang / brtson 'grus kyis pha rol gnon par 'gyur /

analyzed: lag na rdo rje'i rang gi gzugs kyis mdun na nye bar 'dug cing 'dod pa thams cad kyi mchog rjes su sbyin par byed la /

original: rang gi gzugs kyis spyod par byed /
analyzed: rang gi gzugs kyis spyod par byed /

original: mdo sde bshad pa las bstan pa de ltar ri bo po ta la'i gzhal med khang mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mdo sde bshad pa las bstan pa de ltar ri bo po ta la'i gzhal med khang mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: As taught in the Amoghapaśa Sūtra, the palace of Potala Mountain will be seen.

original: rig sngags 'chang de yang 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi gzugs su snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rig sngags 'chang de yang 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi gzugs su snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The knowledge-holder will also appear in the form of noble Avalokiteśvara.

original: ji ltar ri bo po ta la'i gzhal med khang bzhin du ri de la yang gzhal med khang snang ste /
analyzed: ji ltar ri bo po ta la'i gzhal med khang bzhin du ri de la yang gzhal med khang snang ste /
translated: Just as the palace of Potala Mountain appears, so too a palace appears on that mountain.
